39
40struct BlitFramebufferBounds
41{
42 gl::Rectangle sourceBounds;
43 gl::Rectangle sourceRegion;
44
45 gl::Rectangle destBounds;
46 gl::Rectangle destRegion;
47
48 bool xFlipped;
49 bool yFlipped;
50};
51
52static BlitFramebufferBounds GetBlitFramebufferBounds(const gl::Context *context,
53 const gl::Rectangle &sourceArea,
54 const gl::Rectangle &destArea)
55{
56 BlitFramebufferBounds bounds;
57
58 const Framebuffer *sourceFramebuffer = context->getState().getReadFramebuffer();
59 const Framebuffer *destFramebuffer = context->getState().getDrawFramebuffer();
60
61 gl::Extents readSize = sourceFramebuffer->getExtents();
62 gl::Extents drawSize = destFramebuffer->getExtents();
63
64 bounds.sourceBounds = gl::Rectangle(0, 0, readSize.width, readSize.height);
65 bounds.sourceRegion = sourceArea.removeReversal();
66
67 bounds.destBounds = gl::Rectangle(0, 0, drawSize.width, drawSize.height);
68 bounds.destRegion = destArea.removeReversal();
69
70 bounds.xFlipped = sourceArea.isReversedX() != destArea.isReversedX();
71 bounds.yFlipped = sourceArea.isReversedY() != destArea.isReversedY();
72
73 return bounds;
74}
75
76void BindFramebufferAttachment(const FunctionsGL *functions,
77 GLenum attachmentPoint,
78 const FramebufferAttachment *attachment)
79{
80 if (attachment)
81 {
82 if (attachment->type() == GL_TEXTURE)
83 {
84 const Texture *texture = attachment->getTexture();
85 const TextureGL *textureGL = GetImplAs<TextureGL>(texture);
86
87 if (texture->getType() == TextureType::_2D ||
88 texture->getType() == TextureType::_2DMultisample ||
89 texture->getType() == TextureType::Rectangle)
90 {
91 functions->framebufferTexture2D(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, attachmentPoint,
92 ToGLenum(texture->getType()),
93 textureGL->getTextureID(), attachment->mipLevel());
94 }
95 else if (attachment->isLayered())
96 {
97 TextureType textureType = texture->getType();
98 ASSERT(textureType == TextureType::_2DArray || textureType == TextureType::_3D ||
99 textureType == TextureType::CubeMap ||
100 textureType == TextureType::_2DMultisampleArray ||
101 textureType == TextureType::CubeMapArray);
102 functions->framebufferTexture(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, attachmentPoint,
103 textureGL->getTextureID(), attachment->mipLevel());
104 }
105 else if (texture->getType() == TextureType::CubeMap)
106 {
107 functions->framebufferTexture2D(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, attachmentPoint,
108 ToGLenum(attachment->cubeMapFace()),
109 textureGL->getTextureID(), attachment->mipLevel());
110 }
111 else if (texture->getType() == TextureType::_2DArray ||
112 texture->getType() == TextureType::_3D ||
113 texture->getType() == TextureType::_2DMultisampleArray ||
114 texture->getType() == TextureType::CubeMapArray)
115 {
116 if (attachment->isMultiview())
117 {
118 ASSERT(functions->framebufferTexture);
119 functions->framebufferTexture(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, attachmentPoint,
120 textureGL->getTextureID(),
121 attachment->mipLevel());
122 }
123 else
124 {
125 functions->framebufferTextureLayer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, attachmentPoint,
126 textureGL->getTextureID(),
127 attachment->mipLevel(), attachment->layer());
128 }
129 }
130 else
131 {
132 UNREACHABLE();
133 }
134 }
135 else if (attachment->type() == GL_RENDERBUFFER)
136 {
137 const Renderbuffer *renderbuffer = attachment->getRenderbuffer();
138 const RenderbufferGL *renderbufferGL = GetImplAs<RenderbufferGL>(renderbuffer);
139
140 functions->framebufferRenderbuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, attachmentPoint, GL_RENDERBUFFER,
141 renderbufferGL->getRenderbufferID());
142 }
143 else
144 {
145 UNREACHABLE();
146 }
147 }
148 else
149 {
150 // Unbind this attachment
151 functions->framebufferTexture2D(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, attachmentPoint, GL_TEXTURE_2D, 0, 0);
152 }
153}
154
155bool AreAllLayersActive(const FramebufferAttachment &attachment)
156{
157 int baseViewIndex = attachment.getBaseViewIndex();
158 if (baseViewIndex != 0)
159 {
160 return false;
161 }
162 const ImageIndex &imageIndex = attachment.getTextureImageIndex();
163 int numLayers = static_cast<int>(
164 attachment.getTexture()->getDepth(imageIndex.getTarget(), imageIndex.getLevelIndex()));
165 return (attachment.getNumViews() == numLayers);
166}
167
168bool RequiresMultiviewClear(const FramebufferState &state, bool scissorTestEnabled)
169{
170 // Get one attachment and check whether all layers are attached.
171 const FramebufferAttachment *attachment = nullptr;
172 bool allTextureArraysAreFullyAttached = true;
173 for (const FramebufferAttachment &colorAttachment : state.getColorAttachments())
174 {
175 if (colorAttachment.isAttached())
176 {
177 if (!colorAttachment.isMultiview())
178 {
179 return false;
180 }
181 attachment = &colorAttachment;
182 allTextureArraysAreFullyAttached =
183 allTextureArraysAreFullyAttached && AreAllLayersActive(*attachment);
184 }
185 }
186
187 const FramebufferAttachment *depthAttachment = state.getDepthAttachment();
188 if (depthAttachment)
189 {
190 if (!depthAttachment->isMultiview())
191 {
192 return false;
193 }
194 attachment = depthAttachment;
195 allTextureArraysAreFullyAttached =
196 allTextureArraysAreFullyAttached && AreAllLayersActive(*attachment);
197 }
198 const FramebufferAttachment *stencilAttachment = state.getStencilAttachment();
199 if (stencilAttachment)
200 {
201 if (!stencilAttachment->isMultiview())
202 {
203 return false;
204 }
205 attachment = stencilAttachment;
206 allTextureArraysAreFullyAttached =
207 allTextureArraysAreFullyAttached && AreAllLayersActive(*attachment);
208 }
209
210 if (attachment == nullptr)
211 {
212 return false;
213 }
214 if (attachment->isMultiview())
215 {
216 // If all layers of each texture array are active, then there is no need to issue a
217 // special multiview clear.
218 return !allTextureArraysAreFullyAttached;
219 }
220 return false;
221}
222
223bool IsEmulatedAlphaChannelTextureAttachment(const FramebufferAttachment *attachment)
224{
225 if (!attachment || attachment->type() != GL_TEXTURE)
226 {
227 return false;
228 }
229
230 const Texture *texture = attachment->getTexture();
231 const TextureGL *textureGL = GetImplAs<TextureGL>(texture);
232 return textureGL->hasEmulatedAlphaChannel(attachment->getTextureImageIndex());
233}
234
235class ScopedEXTTextureNorm16ReadbackWorkaround
236{
237 public:
238 ScopedEXTTextureNorm16ReadbackWorkaround()
239 : tmpPixels(nullptr), clientPixels(nullptr), enabled(false)
240 {}
241
242 ~ScopedEXTTextureNorm16ReadbackWorkaround()
243 {
244 if (tmpPixels)
245 {
246 delete[] tmpPixels;
247 }
248 }
249
250 angle::Result Initialize(const gl::Context *context,
251 const gl::Rectangle &area,
252 GLenum originalReadFormat,
253 GLenum format,
254 GLenum type,
255 GLuint skipBytes,
256 GLuint rowBytes,
257 GLuint pixelBytes,
258 GLubyte *pixels)
259 {
260 // Separate from constructor as there may be checked math result exception that needs to
261 // early return
262 ASSERT(tmpPixels == nullptr);
263 ASSERT(clientPixels == nullptr);
264
265 ContextGL *contextGL = GetImplAs<ContextGL>(context);
266 const angle::FeaturesGL &features = GetFeaturesGL(context);
267
268 enabled = features.readPixelsUsingImplementationColorReadFormatForNorm16.enabled &&
269 type == GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT && originalReadFormat == GL_RGBA &&
270 (format == GL_RED || format == GL_RG);
271
272 clientPixels = pixels;
273
274 if (enabled)
275 {
276 CheckedNumeric<GLuint> checkedRowBytes(rowBytes);
277 CheckedNumeric<GLuint> checkedRows(area.height);
278 CheckedNumeric<GLuint> checkedSkipBytes(skipBytes);
279 auto checkedAllocatedBytes = checkedSkipBytes + checkedRowBytes * checkedRows;
280 if (rowBytes < area.width * pixelBytes)
281 {
282 checkedAllocatedBytes += area.width * pixelBytes - rowBytes;
283 }
284 ANGLE_CHECK_GL_MATH(contextGL, checkedAllocatedBytes.IsValid());
285 tmpPixels = new GLubyte[checkedAllocatedBytes.ValueOrDie()];
286 memset(tmpPixels, 0, checkedAllocatedBytes.ValueOrDie());
287 }
288
289 return angle::Result::Continue;
290 }
291
292 GLubyte *Pixels() const { return tmpPixels ? tmpPixels : clientPixels; }
293
294 bool IsEnabled() const { return enabled; }
295
296 private:
297 // Temporarily allocated pixel readback buffer
298 GLubyte *tmpPixels;
299 // Client pixel array pointer passed to readPixels
300 GLubyte *clientPixels;
301
302 bool enabled;
303};
304
305// Workaround to rearrange pixels read by RED/RG to RGBA for RGBA/UNSIGNED_SHORT pixel type
306// combination
307angle::Result RearrangeEXTTextureNorm16Pixels(const gl::Context *context,
308 const gl::Rectangle &area,
309 GLenum originalReadFormat,
310 GLenum format,
311 GLenum type,
312 GLuint skipBytes,
313 GLuint rowBytes,
314 GLuint pixelBytes,
315 const gl::PixelPackState &pack,
316 GLubyte *clientPixels,
317 GLubyte *tmpPixels)
318{
319 ASSERT(tmpPixels != nullptr);
320 ASSERT(originalReadFormat == GL_RGBA);
321 ASSERT(format == GL_RED_EXT || format == GL_RG_EXT);
322 ASSERT(type == GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT);
323
324 ContextGL *contextGL = GetImplAs<ContextGL>(context);
325
326 const gl::InternalFormat &glFormatOriginal =
327 gl::GetInternalFormatInfo(originalReadFormat, type);
328
329 GLuint originalReadFormatRowBytes = 0;
330 ANGLE_CHECK_GL_MATH(
331 contextGL, glFormatOriginal.computeRowPitch(type, area.width, pack.alignment,
332 pack.rowLength, &originalReadFormatRowBytes));
333 GLuint originalReadFormatSkipBytes = 0;
334 ANGLE_CHECK_GL_MATH(contextGL,
335 glFormatOriginal.computeSkipBytes(type, originalReadFormatRowBytes, 0, pack,
336 false, &originalReadFormatSkipBytes));
337
338 GLuint originalReadFormatPixelBytes = glFormatOriginal.computePixelBytes(type);
339 GLuint alphaChannelBytes = glFormatOriginal.alphaBits / 8;
340
341 ASSERT(originalReadFormatPixelBytes > pixelBytes);
342 ASSERT(originalReadFormatPixelBytes > alphaChannelBytes);
343 ASSERT(alphaChannelBytes != 0);
344 ASSERT(glFormatOriginal.alphaBits % 8 == 0);
345
346 // Populating rearrangedPixels values from pixels
347 GLubyte *srcRowStart = tmpPixels;
348 GLubyte *dstRowStart = clientPixels;
349
350 srcRowStart += skipBytes;
351 dstRowStart += originalReadFormatSkipBytes;
352
353 for (GLint y = 0; y < area.height; ++y)
354 {
355 GLubyte *src = srcRowStart;
356 GLubyte *dst = dstRowStart;
357 for (GLint x = 0; x < area.width; ++x)
358 {
359 GLushort *srcPixel = reinterpret_cast<GLushort *>(src);
360 GLushort *dstPixel = reinterpret_cast<GLushort *>(dst);
361 dstPixel[0] = srcPixel[0];
362 dstPixel[1] = format == GL_RG ? srcPixel[1] : 0;
363 // Set other channel of RGBA to 0 (GB when format == GL_RED, B when format == GL_RG)
364 dstPixel[2] = 0;
365 // Set alpha channel to 1
366 dstPixel[3] = 0xFFFF;
367
368 src += pixelBytes;
369 dst += originalReadFormatPixelBytes;
370 }
371
372 srcRowStart += rowBytes;
373 dstRowStart += originalReadFormatRowBytes;
374 }
375
376 return angle::Result::Continue;
377}
378
379bool IsValidUnsignedShortReadPixelsFormat(GLenum readFormat, const gl::Context *context)
380{
381 return (readFormat == GL_RED) || (readFormat == GL_RG) || (readFormat == GL_RGBA) ||
382 ((readFormat == GL_DEPTH_COMPONENT) && (context->getExtensions().readDepthNV));
383}
384
385} // namespace
386
387FramebufferGL::FramebufferGL(const gl::FramebufferState &data,
388 GLuint id,
389 bool isDefault,
390 bool emulatedAlpha)
391 : FramebufferImpl(data),
392 mFramebufferID(id),
393 mIsDefault(isDefault),
394 mHasEmulatedAlphaAttachment(emulatedAlpha),
395 mAppliedEnabledDrawBuffers(1)
396{}
397
398FramebufferGL::~FramebufferGL()
399{
400 ASSERT(mFramebufferID == 0);
401}
402
403void FramebufferGL::destroy(const gl::Context *context)
404{
405 StateManagerGL *stateManager = GetStateManagerGL(context);
406 stateManager->deleteFramebuffer(mFramebufferID);
407 mFramebufferID = 0;
408}
409
410angle::Result FramebufferGL::discard(const gl::Context *context,
411 size_t count,
412 const GLenum *attachments)
413{
414 // glInvalidateFramebuffer accepts the same enums as glDiscardFramebufferEXT
415 return invalidate(context, count, attachments);
416}
417
418angle::Result FramebufferGL::invalidate(const gl::Context *context,
419 size_t count,
420 const GLenum *attachments)
421{
422 const GLenum *finalAttachmentsPtr = attachments;
423
424 std::vector<GLenum> modifiedAttachments;
425 if (modifyInvalidateAttachmentsForEmulatedDefaultFBO(count, attachments, &modifiedAttachments))
426 {
427 finalAttachmentsPtr = modifiedAttachments.data();
428 }
429
430 const FunctionsGL *functions = GetFunctionsGL(context);
431 StateManagerGL *stateManager = GetStateManagerGL(context);
432
433 // Since this function is just a hint, only call a native function if it exists.
434 if (functions->invalidateFramebuffer)
435 {
436 stateManager->bindFramebuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, mFramebufferID);
437 functions->invalidateFramebuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, static_cast<GLsizei>(count),
438 finalAttachmentsPtr);
439 }
440 else if (functions->discardFramebufferEXT)
441 {
442 stateManager->bindFramebuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, mFramebufferID);
443 functions->discardFramebufferEXT(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, static_cast<GLsizei>(count),
444 finalAttachmentsPtr);
445 }
446
447 return angle::Result::Continue;
448}
449
450angle::Result FramebufferGL::invalidateSub(const gl::Context *context,
451 size_t count,
452 const GLenum *attachments,
453 const gl::Rectangle &area)
454{
455
456 const GLenum *finalAttachmentsPtr = attachments;
457
458 std::vector<GLenum> modifiedAttachments;
459 if (modifyInvalidateAttachmentsForEmulatedDefaultFBO(count, attachments, &modifiedAttachments))
460 {
461 finalAttachmentsPtr = modifiedAttachments.data();
462 }
463
464 const FunctionsGL *functions = GetFunctionsGL(context);
465 StateManagerGL *stateManager = GetStateManagerGL(context);
466
467 // Since this function is just a hint and not available until OpenGL 4.3, only call it if it is
468 // available.
469 if (functions->invalidateSubFramebuffer)
470 {
471 stateManager->bindFramebuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, mFramebufferID);
472 functions->invalidateSubFramebuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, static_cast<GLsizei>(count),
473 finalAttachmentsPtr, area.x, area.y, area.width,
474 area.height);
475 }
476
477 return angle::Result::Continue;
478}
479
480angle::Result FramebufferGL::clear(const gl::Context *context, GLbitfield mask)
481{
482 const FunctionsGL *functions = GetFunctionsGL(context);
483 StateManagerGL *stateManager = GetStateManagerGL(context);
484
485 syncClearState(context, mask);
486 stateManager->bindFramebuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, mFramebufferID);
487
488 if (!RequiresMultiviewClear(mState, context->getState().isScissorTestEnabled()))
489 {
490 functions->clear(mask);
491 }
492 else
493 {
494 ClearMultiviewGL *multiviewClearer = GetMultiviewClearer(context);
495 multiviewClearer->clearMultiviewFBO(mState, context->getState().getScissor(),
496 ClearMultiviewGL::ClearCommandType::Clear, mask,
497 GL_NONE, 0, nullptr, 0.0f, 0);
498 }
499
500 return angle::Result::Continue;
501}
502
503angle::Result FramebufferGL::clearBufferfv(const gl::Context *context,
504 GLenum buffer,
505 GLint drawbuffer,
506 const GLfloat *values)
507{
508 const FunctionsGL *functions = GetFunctionsGL(context);
509 StateManagerGL *stateManager = GetStateManagerGL(context);
510
511 syncClearBufferState(context, buffer, drawbuffer);
512 stateManager->bindFramebuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, mFramebufferID);
513
514 if (!RequiresMultiviewClear(mState, context->getState().isScissorTestEnabled()))
515 {
516 functions->clearBufferfv(buffer, drawbuffer, values);
517 }
518 else
519 {
520 ClearMultiviewGL *multiviewClearer = GetMultiviewClearer(context);
521 multiviewClearer->clearMultiviewFBO(mState, context->getState().getScissor(),
522 ClearMultiviewGL::ClearCommandType::ClearBufferfv,
523 static_cast<GLbitfield>(0u), buffer, drawbuffer,
524 reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t *>(values), 0.0f, 0);
525 }
526
527 return angle::Result::Continue;
528}
529
530angle::Result FramebufferGL::clearBufferuiv(const gl::Context *context,
531 GLenum buffer,
532 GLint drawbuffer,
533 const GLuint *values)
534{
535 const FunctionsGL *functions = GetFunctionsGL(context);
536 StateManagerGL *stateManager = GetStateManagerGL(context);
537
538 syncClearBufferState(context, buffer, drawbuffer);
539 stateManager->bindFramebuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, mFramebufferID);
540
541 if (!RequiresMultiviewClear(mState, context->getState().isScissorTestEnabled()))
542 {
543 functions->clearBufferuiv(buffer, drawbuffer, values);
544 }
545 else
546 {
547 ClearMultiviewGL *multiviewClearer = GetMultiviewClearer(context);
548 multiviewClearer->clearMultiviewFBO(mState, context->getState().getScissor(),
549 ClearMultiviewGL::ClearCommandType::ClearBufferuiv,
550 static_cast<GLbitfield>(0u), buffer, drawbuffer,
551 reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t *>(values), 0.0f, 0);
552 }
553
554 return angle::Result::Continue;
555}
556
557angle::Result FramebufferGL::clearBufferiv(const gl::Context *context,
558 GLenum buffer,
559 GLint drawbuffer,
560 const GLint *values)
561{
562 const FunctionsGL *functions = GetFunctionsGL(context);
563 StateManagerGL *stateManager = GetStateManagerGL(context);
564
565 syncClearBufferState(context, buffer, drawbuffer);
566 stateManager->bindFramebuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, mFramebufferID);
567
568 if (!RequiresMultiviewClear(mState, context->getState().isScissorTestEnabled()))
569 {
570 functions->clearBufferiv(buffer, drawbuffer, values);
571 }
572 else
573 {
574 ClearMultiviewGL *multiviewClearer = GetMultiviewClearer(context);
575 multiviewClearer->clearMultiviewFBO(mState, context->getState().getScissor(),
576 ClearMultiviewGL::ClearCommandType::ClearBufferiv,
577 static_cast<GLbitfield>(0u), buffer, drawbuffer,
578 reinterpret_cast<const uint8_t *>(values), 0.0f, 0);
579 }
580
581 return angle::Result::Continue;
582}
583
584angle::Result FramebufferGL::clearBufferfi(const gl::Context *context,
585 GLenum buffer,
586 GLint drawbuffer,
587 GLfloat depth,
588 GLint stencil)
589{
590 const FunctionsGL *functions = GetFunctionsGL(context);
591 StateManagerGL *stateManager = GetStateManagerGL(context);
592
593 syncClearBufferState(context, buffer, drawbuffer);
594 stateManager->bindFramebuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, mFramebufferID);
595
596 if (!RequiresMultiviewClear(mState, context->getState().isScissorTestEnabled()))
597 {
598 functions->clearBufferfi(buffer, drawbuffer, depth, stencil);
599 }
600 else
601 {
602 ClearMultiviewGL *multiviewClearer = GetMultiviewClearer(context);
603 multiviewClearer->clearMultiviewFBO(mState, context->getState().getScissor(),
604 ClearMultiviewGL::ClearCommandType::ClearBufferfi,
605 static_cast<GLbitfield>(0u), buffer, drawbuffer,
606 nullptr, depth, stencil);
607 }
608
609 return angle::Result::Continue;
610}
611
612angle::Result FramebufferGL::readPixels(const gl::Context *context,
613 const gl::Rectangle &area,
614 GLenum format,
615 GLenum type,
616 const gl::PixelPackState &pack,
617 gl::Buffer *packBuffer,
618 void *pixels)
619{
620 ContextGL *contextGL = GetImplAs<ContextGL>(context);
621 const FunctionsGL *functions = GetFunctionsGL(context);
622 StateManagerGL *stateManager = GetStateManagerGL(context);
623 const angle::FeaturesGL &features = GetFeaturesGL(context);
624 gl::PixelPackState packState = pack;
625
626 // Clip read area to framebuffer.
627 const auto *readAttachment = mState.getReadPixelsAttachment(format);
628 const gl::Extents fbSize = readAttachment->getSize();
629 const gl::Rectangle fbRect(0, 0, fbSize.width, fbSize.height);
630 gl::Rectangle clippedArea;
631 if (!ClipRectangle(area, fbRect, &clippedArea))
632 {
633 // nothing to read
634 return angle::Result::Continue;
635 }
636
637 GLenum attachmentReadFormat =
638 readAttachment->getFormat().info->getReadPixelsFormat(context->getExtensions());
639 nativegl::ReadPixelsFormat readPixelsFormat =
640 nativegl::GetReadPixelsFormat(functions, features, attachmentReadFormat, format, type);
641 GLenum readFormat = readPixelsFormat.format;
642 GLenum readType = readPixelsFormat.type;
643 if (features.readPixelsUsingImplementationColorReadFormatForNorm16.enabled &&
644 readType == GL_UNSIGNED_SHORT)
645 {
646 ANGLE_CHECK(contextGL, IsValidUnsignedShortReadPixelsFormat(readFormat, context),
647 "glReadPixels: GL_IMPLEMENTATION_COLOR_READ_FORMAT advertised by the driver is "
648 "not handled by RGBA16 readPixels workaround.",
649 GL_INVALID_OPERATION);
650 }
651
652 stateManager->bindFramebuffer(GL_READ_FRAMEBUFFER, mFramebufferID);
653
654 bool useOverlappingRowsWorkaround = features.packOverlappingRowsSeparatelyPackBuffer.enabled &&
655 packBuffer && packState.rowLength != 0 &&
656 packState.rowLength < clippedArea.width;
657
658 GLubyte *outPtr = static_cast<GLubyte *>(pixels);
659 int leftClip = clippedArea.x - area.x;
660 int topClip = clippedArea.y - area.y;
661 if (leftClip || topClip)
662 {
663 // Adjust destination to match portion clipped off left and/or top.
664 const gl::InternalFormat &glFormat = gl::GetInternalFormatInfo(readFormat, readType);
665
666 GLuint rowBytes = 0;
667 ANGLE_CHECK_GL_MATH(contextGL,
668 glFormat.computeRowPitch(readType, area.width, packState.alignment,
669 packState.rowLength, &rowBytes));
670 outPtr += leftClip * glFormat.pixelBytes + topClip * rowBytes;
671 }
672
673 if (packState.rowLength == 0 && clippedArea.width != area.width)
674 {
675 // No rowLength was specified so it will derive from read width, but clipping changed the
676 // read width. Use the original width so we fill the user's buffer as they intended.
677 packState.rowLength = area.width;
678 }
679
680 // We want to use rowLength, but that might not be supported.
681 bool cannotSetDesiredRowLength =
682 packState.rowLength && !GetImplAs<ContextGL>(context)->getNativeExtensions().packSubimage;
683
684 bool usePackSkipWorkaround = features.emulatePackSkipRowsAndPackSkipPixels.enabled &&
685 (packState.skipRows != 0 || packState.skipPixels != 0);
686
687 if (cannotSetDesiredRowLength || useOverlappingRowsWorkaround || usePackSkipWorkaround)
688 {
689 return readPixelsRowByRow(context, clippedArea, format, readFormat, readType, packState,
690 outPtr);
691 }
692
693 bool useLastRowPaddingWorkaround = false;
694 if (features.packLastRowSeparatelyForPaddingInclusion.enabled)
695 {
696 ANGLE_TRY(ShouldApplyLastRowPaddingWorkaround(
697 contextGL, gl::Extents(clippedArea.width, clippedArea.height, 1), packState, packBuffer,
698 readFormat, readType, false, outPtr, &useLastRowPaddingWorkaround));
699 }
700
701 return readPixelsAllAtOnce(context, clippedArea, format, readFormat, readType, packState,
702 outPtr, useLastRowPaddingWorkaround);
703}
704
705angle::Result FramebufferGL::blit(const gl::Context *context,
706 const gl::Rectangle &sourceArea,
707 const gl::Rectangle &destArea,
708 GLbitfield mask,
709 GLenum filter)
710{
711 const FunctionsGL *functions = GetFunctionsGL(context);
712 StateManagerGL *stateManager = GetStateManagerGL(context);
713 const angle::FeaturesGL &features = GetFeaturesGL(context);
714
715 const Framebuffer *sourceFramebuffer = context->getState().getReadFramebuffer();
716 const Framebuffer *destFramebuffer = context->getState().getDrawFramebuffer();
717
718 const FramebufferAttachment *colorReadAttachment = sourceFramebuffer->getReadColorAttachment();
719
720 GLsizei readAttachmentSamples = 0;
721 if (colorReadAttachment != nullptr)
722 {
723 // Blitting requires that the textures be single sampled. getSamples will return
724 // emulated sample number, but the EXT_multisampled_render_to_texture extension will
725 // take care of resolving the texture, so even if emulated samples > 0, we should still
726 // be able to blit as long as the underlying resource samples is single sampled.
727 readAttachmentSamples = colorReadAttachment->getResourceSamples();
728 }
729
730 bool needManualColorBlit = false;
731
732 // TODO(cwallez) when the filter is LINEAR and both source and destination are SRGB, we
733 // could avoid doing a manual blit.
734
735 // Prior to OpenGL 4.4 BlitFramebuffer (section 18.3.1 of GL 4.3 core profile) reads:
736 // When values are taken from the read buffer, no linearization is performed, even
737 // if the format of the buffer is SRGB.
738 // Starting from OpenGL 4.4 (section 18.3.1) it reads:
739 // When values are taken from the read buffer, if FRAMEBUFFER_SRGB is enabled and the
740 // value of FRAMEBUFFER_ATTACHMENT_COLOR_ENCODING for the framebuffer attachment
741 // corresponding to the read buffer is SRGB, the red, green, and blue components are
742 // converted from the non-linear sRGB color space according [...].
743 {
744 bool sourceSRGB =
745 colorReadAttachment != nullptr && colorReadAttachment->getColorEncoding() == GL_SRGB;
746 needManualColorBlit =
747 needManualColorBlit || (sourceSRGB && functions->isAtMostGL(gl::Version(4, 3)));
748 }
749
750 // Prior to OpenGL 4.2 BlitFramebuffer (section 4.3.2 of GL 4.1 core profile) reads:
751 // Blit operations bypass the fragment pipeline. The only fragment operations which
752 // affect a blit are the pixel ownership test and scissor test.
753 // Starting from OpenGL 4.2 (section 4.3.2) it reads:
754 // When values are written to the draw buffers, blit operations bypass the fragment
755 // pipeline. The only fragment operations which affect a blit are the pixel ownership
756 // test, the scissor test and sRGB conversion.
757 if (!needManualColorBlit)
758 {
759 bool destSRGB = false;
760 for (size_t i = 0; i < destFramebuffer->getDrawbufferStateCount(); ++i)
761 {
762 const FramebufferAttachment *attachment = destFramebuffer->getDrawBuffer(i);
763 if (attachment && attachment->getColorEncoding() == GL_SRGB)
764 {
765 destSRGB = true;
766 break;
767 }
768 }
769
770 needManualColorBlit =
771 needManualColorBlit || (destSRGB && functions->isAtMostGL(gl::Version(4, 1)));
772 }
773
774 // If the destination has an emulated alpha channel, we need to blit with a shader with alpha
775 // writes disabled.
776 if (mHasEmulatedAlphaAttachment)
777 {
778 needManualColorBlit = true;
779 }
780
781 // Enable FRAMEBUFFER_SRGB if needed
782 stateManager->setFramebufferSRGBEnabledForFramebuffer(context, true, this);
783
784 GLenum blitMask = mask;
785 if (needManualColorBlit && (mask & GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT) && readAttachmentSamples <= 1)
786 {
787 BlitGL *blitter = GetBlitGL(context);
788 ANGLE_TRY(blitter->blitColorBufferWithShader(context, sourceFramebuffer, destFramebuffer,
789 sourceArea, destArea, filter,
790 !mHasEmulatedAlphaAttachment));
791 blitMask &= ~GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT;
792 }
793
794 if (blitMask == 0)
795 {
796 return angle::Result::Continue;
797 }
798
799 const FramebufferGL *sourceFramebufferGL = GetImplAs<FramebufferGL>(sourceFramebuffer);
800 stateManager->bindFramebuffer(GL_READ_FRAMEBUFFER, sourceFramebufferGL->getFramebufferID());
801 stateManager->bindFramebuffer(GL_DRAW_FRAMEBUFFER, mFramebufferID);
802
803 gl::Rectangle finalSourceArea(sourceArea);
804 gl::Rectangle finalDestArea(destArea);
805
806 if (features.adjustSrcDstRegionBlitFramebuffer.enabled)
807 {
808 angle::Result result = adjustSrcDstRegion(context, finalSourceArea, finalDestArea,
809 &finalSourceArea, &finalDestArea);
810 if (result != angle::Result::Continue)
811 {
812 return result;
813 }
814 }
815 if (features.clipSrcRegionBlitFramebuffer.enabled)
816 {
817 angle::Result result = clipSrcRegion(context, finalSourceArea, finalDestArea,
818 &finalSourceArea, &finalDestArea);
819 if (result != angle::Result::Continue)
820 {
821 return result;
822 }
823 }
824
825 functions->blitFramebuffer(finalSourceArea.x, finalSourceArea.y, finalSourceArea.x1(),
826 finalSourceArea.y1(), finalDestArea.x, finalDestArea.y,
827 finalDestArea.x1(), finalDestArea.y1(), blitMask, filter);
828
829 return angle::Result::Continue;
830}
831
832angle::Result FramebufferGL::adjustSrcDstRegion(const gl::Context *context,
833 const gl::Rectangle &sourceArea,
834 const gl::Rectangle &destArea,
835 gl::Rectangle *newSourceArea,
836 gl::Rectangle *newDestArea)
837{
838 BlitFramebufferBounds bounds = GetBlitFramebufferBounds(context, sourceArea, destArea);
839
840 if (bounds.destRegion.width == 0 || bounds.sourceRegion.width == 0 ||
841 bounds.destRegion.height == 0 || bounds.sourceRegion.height == 0)
842 {
843 return angle::Result::Stop;
844 }
845 if (!ClipRectangle(bounds.destBounds, bounds.destRegion, nullptr))
846 {
847 return angle::Result::Stop;
848 }
849
850 if (!bounds.destBounds.encloses(bounds.destRegion))
851 {
852 // destRegion is not within destBounds. We want to adjust it to a
853 // reasonable size. This is done by halving the destRegion until it is at
854 // most twice the size of the framebuffer. We cut it in half instead
855 // of arbitrarily shrinking it to fit so that we don't end up with
856 // non-power-of-two scale factors which could mess up pixel interpolation.
857 // Naively clipping the dst rect and then proportionally sizing the
858 // src rect yields incorrect results.
859
860 GLuint destXHalvings = 0;
861 GLuint destYHalvings = 0;
862 GLint destOriginX = bounds.destRegion.x;
863 GLint destOriginY = bounds.destRegion.y;
864
865 GLint destClippedWidth = bounds.destRegion.width;
866 while (destClippedWidth > 2 * bounds.destBounds.width)
867 {
868 destClippedWidth = destClippedWidth / 2;
869 destXHalvings++;
870 }
871
872 GLint destClippedHeight = bounds.destRegion.height;
873 while (destClippedHeight > 2 * bounds.destBounds.height)
874 {
875 destClippedHeight = destClippedHeight / 2;
876 destYHalvings++;
877 }
878
879 // Before this block, we check that the two rectangles intersect.
880 // Now, compute the location of a new region origin such that we use the
881 // scaled dimensions but the new region has the same intersection as the
882 // original region.
883
884 GLint left = bounds.destRegion.x0();
885 GLint right = bounds.destRegion.x1();
886 GLint top = bounds.destRegion.y0();
887 GLint bottom = bounds.destRegion.y1();
888
889 GLint extraXOffset = 0;
890 if (left >= 0 && left < bounds.destBounds.width)
891 {
892 // Left edge is in-bounds
893 destOriginX = bounds.destRegion.x;
894 }
895 else if (right > 0 && right <= bounds.destBounds.width)
896 {
897 // Right edge is in-bounds
898 destOriginX = right - destClippedWidth;
899 }
900 else
901 {
902 // Region completely spans bounds
903 extraXOffset = (bounds.destRegion.width - destClippedWidth) / 2;
904 destOriginX = bounds.destRegion.x + extraXOffset;
905 }
906
907 GLint extraYOffset = 0;
908 if (top >= 0 && top < bounds.destBounds.height)
909 {
910 // Top edge is in-bounds
911 destOriginY = bounds.destRegion.y;
912 }
913 else if (bottom > 0 && bottom <= bounds.destBounds.height)
914 {
915 // Bottom edge is in-bounds
916 destOriginY = bottom - destClippedHeight;
917 }
918 else
919 {
920 // Region completely spans bounds
921 extraYOffset = (bounds.destRegion.height - destClippedHeight) / 2;
922 destOriginY = bounds.destRegion.y + extraYOffset;
923 }
924
925 // Offsets from the bottom left corner of the original region to
926 // the bottom left corner of the clipped region.
927 // This value (after it is scaled) is the respective offset we will apply
928 // to the src origin.
929
930 CheckedNumeric<GLuint> checkedXOffset(destOriginX - bounds.destRegion.x - extraXOffset / 2);
931 CheckedNumeric<GLuint> checkedYOffset(destOriginY - bounds.destRegion.y - extraYOffset / 2);
932
933 // if X/Y is reversed, use the top/right out-of-bounds region to compute
934 // the origin offset instead of the left/bottom out-of-bounds region
935 if (bounds.xFlipped)
936 {
937 checkedXOffset =
938 (bounds.destRegion.x1() - (destOriginX + destClippedWidth) + extraXOffset / 2);
939 }
940 if (bounds.yFlipped)
941 {
942 checkedYOffset =
943 (bounds.destRegion.y1() - (destOriginY + destClippedHeight) + extraYOffset / 2);
944 }
945
946 // These offsets should never overflow
947 GLuint xOffset, yOffset;
948 if (!checkedXOffset.AssignIfValid(&xOffset) || !checkedYOffset.AssignIfValid(&yOffset))
949 {
950 UNREACHABLE();
951 return angle::Result::Stop;
952 }
953
954 bounds.destRegion =
955 gl::Rectangle(destOriginX, destOriginY, destClippedWidth, destClippedHeight);
956
957 // Adjust the src region by the same factor
958 bounds.sourceRegion = gl::Rectangle(bounds.sourceRegion.x + (xOffset >> destXHalvings),
959 bounds.sourceRegion.y + (yOffset >> destYHalvings),
960 bounds.sourceRegion.width >> destXHalvings,
961 bounds.sourceRegion.height >> destYHalvings);
962
963 // if the src was scaled to 0, set it to 1 so the src is non-empty
964 if (bounds.sourceRegion.width == 0)
965 {
966 bounds.sourceRegion.width = 1;
967 }
968 if (bounds.sourceRegion.height == 0)
969 {
970 bounds.sourceRegion.height = 1;
971 }
972 }
973
974 if (!bounds.sourceBounds.encloses(bounds.sourceRegion))
975 {
976 // sourceRegion is not within sourceBounds. We want to adjust it to a
977 // reasonable size. This is done by halving the sourceRegion until it is at
978 // most twice the size of the framebuffer. We cut it in half instead
979 // of arbitrarily shrinking it to fit so that we don't end up with
980 // non-power-of-two scale factors which could mess up pixel interpolation.
981 // Naively clipping the source rect and then proportionally sizing the
982 // dest rect yields incorrect results.
983
984 GLuint sourceXHalvings = 0;
985 GLuint sourceYHalvings = 0;
986 GLint sourceOriginX = bounds.sourceRegion.x;
987 GLint sourceOriginY = bounds.sourceRegion.y;
988
989 GLint sourceClippedWidth = bounds.sourceRegion.width;
990 while (sourceClippedWidth > 2 * bounds.sourceBounds.width)
991 {
992 sourceClippedWidth = sourceClippedWidth / 2;
993 sourceXHalvings++;
994 }
995
996 GLint sourceClippedHeight = bounds.sourceRegion.height;
997 while (sourceClippedHeight > 2 * bounds.sourceBounds.height)
998 {
999 sourceClippedHeight = sourceClippedHeight / 2;
1000 sourceYHalvings++;
1001 }
1002
1003 // Before this block, we check that the two rectangles intersect.
1004 // Now, compute the location of a new region origin such that we use the
1005 // scaled dimensions but the new region has the same intersection as the
1006 // original region.
1007
1008 GLint left = bounds.sourceRegion.x0();
1009 GLint right = bounds.sourceRegion.x1();
1010 GLint top = bounds.sourceRegion.y0();
1011 GLint bottom = bounds.sourceRegion.y1();
1012
1013 GLint extraXOffset = 0;
1014 if (left >= 0 && left < bounds.sourceBounds.width)
1015 {
1016 // Left edge is in-bounds
1017 sourceOriginX = bounds.sourceRegion.x;
1018 }
1019 else if (right > 0 && right <= bounds.sourceBounds.width)
1020 {
1021 // Right edge is in-bounds
1022 sourceOriginX = right - sourceClippedWidth;
1023 }
1024 else
1025 {
1026 // Region completely spans bounds
1027 extraXOffset = (bounds.sourceRegion.width - sourceClippedWidth) / 2;
1028 sourceOriginX = bounds.sourceRegion.x + extraXOffset;
1029 }
1030
1031 GLint extraYOffset = 0;
1032 if (top >= 0 && top < bounds.sourceBounds.height)
1033 {
1034 // Top edge is in-bounds
1035 sourceOriginY = bounds.sourceRegion.y;
1036 }
1037 else if (bottom > 0 && bottom <= bounds.sourceBounds.height)
1038 {
1039 // Bottom edge is in-bounds
1040 sourceOriginY = bottom - sourceClippedHeight;
1041 }
1042 else
1043 {
1044 // Region completely spans bounds
1045 extraYOffset = (bounds.sourceRegion.height - sourceClippedHeight) / 2;
1046 sourceOriginY = bounds.sourceRegion.y + extraYOffset;
1047 }
1048
1049 // Offsets from the bottom left corner of the original region to
1050 // the bottom left corner of the clipped region.
1051 // This value (after it is scaled) is the respective offset we will apply
1052 // to the dest origin.
1053
1054 CheckedNumeric<GLuint> checkedXOffset(sourceOriginX - bounds.sourceRegion.x -
1055 extraXOffset / 2);
1056 CheckedNumeric<GLuint> checkedYOffset(sourceOriginY - bounds.sourceRegion.y -
1057 extraYOffset / 2);
1058
1059 // if X/Y is reversed, use the top/right out-of-bounds region to compute
1060 // the origin offset instead of the left/bottom out-of-bounds region
1061 if (bounds.xFlipped)
1062 {
1063 checkedXOffset = (bounds.sourceRegion.x1() - (sourceOriginX + sourceClippedWidth) +
1064 extraXOffset / 2);
1065 }
1066 if (bounds.yFlipped)
1067 {
1068 checkedYOffset = (bounds.sourceRegion.y1() - (sourceOriginY + sourceClippedHeight) +
1069 extraYOffset / 2);
1070 }
1071
1072 // These offsets should never overflow
1073 GLuint xOffset, yOffset;
1074 if (!checkedXOffset.AssignIfValid(&xOffset) || !checkedYOffset.AssignIfValid(&yOffset))
1075 {
1076 UNREACHABLE();
1077 return angle::Result::Stop;
1078 }
1079
1080 bounds.sourceRegion =
1081 gl::Rectangle(sourceOriginX, sourceOriginY, sourceClippedWidth, sourceClippedHeight);
1082
1083 // Adjust the dest region by the same factor
1084 bounds.destRegion = gl::Rectangle(bounds.destRegion.x + (xOffset >> sourceXHalvings),
1085 bounds.destRegion.y + (yOffset >> sourceYHalvings),
1086 bounds.destRegion.width >> sourceXHalvings,
1087 bounds.destRegion.height >> sourceYHalvings);
1088 }
1089 // Set the src and dst endpoints. If they were previously flipped,
1090 // set them as flipped.
1091 *newSourceArea = bounds.sourceRegion.flip(sourceArea.isReversedX(), sourceArea.isReversedY());
1092 *newDestArea = bounds.destRegion.flip(destArea.isReversedX(), destArea.isReversedY());
1093
1094 return angle::Result::Continue;
1095}
1096
1097angle::Result FramebufferGL::clipSrcRegion(const gl::Context *context,
1098 const gl::Rectangle &sourceArea,
1099 const gl::Rectangle &destArea,
1100 gl::Rectangle *newSourceArea,
1101 gl::Rectangle *newDestArea)
1102{
1103 BlitFramebufferBounds bounds = GetBlitFramebufferBounds(context, sourceArea, destArea);
1104
1105 if (bounds.destRegion.width == 0 || bounds.sourceRegion.width == 0 ||
1106 bounds.destRegion.height == 0 || bounds.sourceRegion.height == 0)
1107 {
1108 return angle::Result::Stop;
1109 }
1110 if (!ClipRectangle(bounds.destBounds, bounds.destRegion, nullptr))
1111 {
1112 return angle::Result::Stop;
1113 }
1114
1115 if (!bounds.sourceBounds.encloses(bounds.sourceRegion))
1116 {
1117 // If pixels lying outside the read framebuffer, adjust src region
1118 // and dst region to appropriate in-bounds regions respectively.
1119 gl::Rectangle realSourceRegion;
1120 if (!ClipRectangle(bounds.sourceRegion, bounds.sourceBounds, &realSourceRegion))
1121 {
1122 return angle::Result::Stop;
1123 }
1124 GLuint xOffset = realSourceRegion.x - bounds.sourceRegion.x;
1125 GLuint yOffset = realSourceRegion.y - bounds.sourceRegion.y;
1126
1127 // if X/Y is reversed, use the top/right out-of-bounds region for mapping
1128 // to dst region, instead of left/bottom out-of-bounds region for mapping.
1129 if (bounds.xFlipped)
1130 {
1131 xOffset = bounds.sourceRegion.x1() - realSourceRegion.x1();
1132 }
1133 if (bounds.yFlipped)
1134 {
1135 yOffset = bounds.sourceRegion.y1() - realSourceRegion.y1();
1136 }
1137
1138 GLfloat destMappingWidth = static_cast<GLfloat>(realSourceRegion.width) *
1139 bounds.destRegion.width / bounds.sourceRegion.width;
1140 GLfloat destMappingHeight = static_cast<GLfloat>(realSourceRegion.height) *
1141 bounds.destRegion.height / bounds.sourceRegion.height;
1142 GLfloat destMappingXOffset =
1143 static_cast<GLfloat>(xOffset) * bounds.destRegion.width / bounds.sourceRegion.width;
1144 GLfloat destMappingYOffset =
1145 static_cast<GLfloat>(yOffset) * bounds.destRegion.height / bounds.sourceRegion.height;
1146
1147 GLuint destMappingX0 =
1148 static_cast<GLuint>(std::round(bounds.destRegion.x + destMappingXOffset));
1149 GLuint destMappingY0 =
1150 static_cast<GLuint>(std::round(bounds.destRegion.y + destMappingYOffset));
1151
1152 GLuint destMappingX1 = static_cast<GLuint>(
1153 std::round(bounds.destRegion.x + destMappingXOffset + destMappingWidth));
1154 GLuint destMappingY1 = static_cast<GLuint>(
1155 std::round(bounds.destRegion.y + destMappingYOffset + destMappingHeight));
1156
1157 bounds.destRegion =
1158 gl::Rectangle(destMappingX0, destMappingY0, destMappingX1 - destMappingX0,
1159 destMappingY1 - destMappingY0);
1160
1161 bounds.sourceRegion = realSourceRegion;
1162 }
1163 // Set the src and dst endpoints. If they were previously flipped,
1164 // set them as flipped.
1165 *newSourceArea = bounds.sourceRegion.flip(sourceArea.isReversedX(), sourceArea.isReversedY());
1166 *newDestArea = bounds.destRegion.flip(destArea.isReversedX(), destArea.isReversedY());
1167
1168 return angle::Result::Continue;
1169}
1170
1171angle::Result FramebufferGL::getSamplePosition(const gl::Context *context,
1172 size_t index,
1173 GLfloat *xy) const
1174{
1175 const FunctionsGL *functions = GetFunctionsGL(context);
1176 StateManagerGL *stateManager = GetStateManagerGL(context);
1177
1178 stateManager->bindFramebuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, mFramebufferID);
1179 functions->getMultisamplefv(GL_SAMPLE_POSITION, static_cast<GLuint>(index), xy);
1180 return angle::Result::Continue;
1181}
1182
1183bool FramebufferGL::shouldSyncStateBeforeCheckStatus() const
1184{
1185 return true;
1186}
1187
1188bool FramebufferGL::checkStatus(const gl::Context *context) const
1189{
1190 const FunctionsGL *functions = GetFunctionsGL(context);
1191 StateManagerGL *stateManager = GetStateManagerGL(context);
1192
1193 stateManager->bindFramebuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, mFramebufferID);
1194 GLenum status = functions->checkFramebufferStatus(GL_FRAMEBUFFER);
1195 if (status != GL_FRAMEBUFFER_COMPLETE)
1196 {
1197 WARN() << "GL framebuffer returned incomplete.";
1198 }
1199 return (status == GL_FRAMEBUFFER_COMPLETE);
1200}
1201
1202angle::Result FramebufferGL::syncState(const gl::Context *context,
1203 GLenum binding,
1204 const gl::Framebuffer::DirtyBits &dirtyBits,
1205 gl::Command command)
1206{
1207 // Don't need to sync state for the default FBO.
1208 if (mIsDefault)
1209 {
1210 return angle::Result::Continue;
1211 }
1212
1213 const FunctionsGL *functions = GetFunctionsGL(context);
1214 StateManagerGL *stateManager = GetStateManagerGL(context);
1215
1216 stateManager->bindFramebuffer(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, mFramebufferID);
1217
1218 // A pointer to one of the attachments for which the texture or the render buffer is not zero.
1219 const FramebufferAttachment *attachment = nullptr;
1220
1221 for (auto dirtyBit : dirtyBits)
1222 {
1223 switch (dirtyBit)
1224 {
1225 case Framebuffer::DIRTY_BIT_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT:
1226 {
1227 const FramebufferAttachment *newAttachment = mState.getDepthAttachment();
1228 BindFramebufferAttachment(functions, GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT, newAttachment);
1229 if (newAttachment)
1230 {
1231 attachment = newAttachment;
1232 }
1233 break;
1234 }
1235 case Framebuffer::DIRTY_BIT_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT:
1236 {
1237 const FramebufferAttachment *newAttachment = mState.getStencilAttachment();
1238 BindFramebufferAttachment(functions, GL_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT, newAttachment);
1239 if (newAttachment)
1240 {
1241 attachment = newAttachment;
1242 }
1243 break;
1244 }
1245 case Framebuffer::DIRTY_BIT_DRAW_BUFFERS:
1246 {
1247 const auto &drawBuffers = mState.getDrawBufferStates();
1248 functions->drawBuffers(static_cast<GLsizei>(drawBuffers.size()),
1249 drawBuffers.data());
1250 mAppliedEnabledDrawBuffers = mState.getEnabledDrawBuffers();
1251 break;
1252 }
1253 case Framebuffer::DIRTY_BIT_READ_BUFFER:
1254 functions->readBuffer(mState.getReadBufferState());
1255 break;
1256 case Framebuffer::DIRTY_BIT_DEFAULT_WIDTH:
1257 functions->framebufferParameteri(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, GL_FRAMEBUFFER_DEFAULT_WIDTH,
1258 mState.getDefaultWidth());
1259 break;
1260 case Framebuffer::DIRTY_BIT_DEFAULT_HEIGHT:
1261 functions->framebufferParameteri(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, GL_FRAMEBUFFER_DEFAULT_HEIGHT,
1262 mState.getDefaultHeight());
1263 break;
1264 case Framebuffer::DIRTY_BIT_DEFAULT_SAMPLES:
1265 functions->framebufferParameteri(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, GL_FRAMEBUFFER_DEFAULT_SAMPLES,
1266 mState.getDefaultSamples());
1267 break;
1268 case Framebuffer::DIRTY_BIT_DEFAULT_FIXED_SAMPLE_LOCATIONS:
1269 functions->framebufferParameteri(
1270 GL_FRAMEBUFFER, GL_FRAMEBUFFER_DEFAULT_FIXED_SAMPLE_LOCATIONS,
1271 gl::ConvertToGLBoolean(mState.getDefaultFixedSampleLocations()));
1272 break;
1273 case Framebuffer::DIRTY_BIT_DEFAULT_LAYERS:
1274 functions->framebufferParameteri(GL_FRAMEBUFFER, GL_FRAMEBUFFER_DEFAULT_LAYERS_EXT,
1275 mState.getDefaultLayers());
1276 break;
1277 default:
1278 {
1279 static_assert(Framebuffer::DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_0 == 0, "FB dirty bits");
1280 if (dirtyBit < Framebuffer::DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_MAX)
1281 {
1282 size_t index =
1283 static_cast<size_t>(dirtyBit - Framebuffer::DIRTY_BIT_COLOR_ATTACHMENT_0);
1284 const FramebufferAttachment *newAttachment = mState.getColorAttachment(index);
1285 BindFramebufferAttachment(functions,
1286 static_cast<GLenum>(GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0 + index),
1287 newAttachment);
1288 if (newAttachment)
1289 {
1290 attachment = newAttachment;
1291 }
1292
1293 // Hiding an alpha channel is only supported when it's the first attachment
1294 // currently. Assert that these emulated textures are not bound to a framebuffer
1295 // using MRT.
1296 if (index == 0)
1297 {
1298 mHasEmulatedAlphaAttachment =
1299 IsEmulatedAlphaChannelTextureAttachment(attachment);
1300 }
1301 ASSERT(index == 0 || !IsEmulatedAlphaChannelTextureAttachment(attachment));
1302 }
1303 break;
1304 }
1305 }
1306 }
1307
1308 if (attachment && mState.id() == context->getState().getDrawFramebuffer()->id())
1309 {
1310 stateManager->updateMultiviewBaseViewLayerIndexUniform(context->getState().getProgram(),
1311 getState());
1312 }
1313
1314 return angle::Result::Continue;
1315}
1316
1317GLuint FramebufferGL::getFramebufferID() const
1318{
1319 return mFramebufferID;
1320}
1321
1322bool FramebufferGL::isDefault() const
1323{
1324 return mIsDefault;
1325}
1326
1327bool FramebufferGL::hasEmulatedAlphaChannelTextureAttachment() const
1328{
1329 return mHasEmulatedAlphaAttachment;
1330}
1331
1332void FramebufferGL::syncClearState(const gl::Context *context, GLbitfield mask)
1333{
1334 const FunctionsGL *functions = GetFunctionsGL(context);
1335
1336 if (functions->standard == STANDARD_GL_DESKTOP)
1337 {
1338 StateManagerGL *stateManager = GetStateManagerGL(context);
1339 const angle::FeaturesGL &features = GetFeaturesGL(context);
1340
1341 if (features.doesSRGBClearsOnLinearFramebufferAttachments.enabled &&
1342 (mask & GL_COLOR_BUFFER_BIT) != 0 && !mIsDefault)
1343 {
1344 bool hasSRGBAttachment = false;
1345 for (const auto &attachment : mState.getColorAttachments())
1346 {
1347 if (attachment.isAttached() && attachment.getColorEncoding() == GL_SRGB)
1348 {
1349 hasSRGBAttachment = true;
1350 break;
1351 }
1352 }
1353
1354 stateManager->setFramebufferSRGBEnabled(context, hasSRGBAttachment);
1355 }
1356 else
1357 {
1358 stateManager->setFramebufferSRGBEnabled(context, !mIsDefault);
1359 }
1360 }
1361}
1362
1363void FramebufferGL::syncClearBufferState(const gl::Context *context,
1364 GLenum buffer,
1365 GLint drawBuffer)
1366{
1367 const FunctionsGL *functions = GetFunctionsGL(context);
1368
1369 if (functions->standard == STANDARD_GL_DESKTOP)
1370 {
1371 StateManagerGL *stateManager = GetStateManagerGL(context);
1372 const angle::FeaturesGL &features = GetFeaturesGL(context);
1373
1374 if (features.doesSRGBClearsOnLinearFramebufferAttachments.enabled && buffer == GL_COLOR &&
1375 !mIsDefault)
1376 {
1377 // If doing a clear on a color buffer, set SRGB blend enabled only if the color buffer
1378 // is an SRGB format.
1379 const auto &drawbufferState = mState.getDrawBufferStates();
1380 const auto &colorAttachments = mState.getColorAttachments();
1381
1382 const FramebufferAttachment *attachment = nullptr;
1383 if (drawbufferState[drawBuffer] >= GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0 &&
1384 drawbufferState[drawBuffer] < GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0 + colorAttachments.size())
1385 {
1386 size_t attachmentIdx =
1387 static_cast<size_t>(drawbufferState[drawBuffer] - GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0);
1388 attachment = &colorAttachments[attachmentIdx];
1389 }
1390
1391 if (attachment != nullptr)
1392 {
1393 stateManager->setFramebufferSRGBEnabled(context,
1394 attachment->getColorEncoding() == GL_SRGB);
1395 }
1396 }
1397 else
1398 {
1399 stateManager->setFramebufferSRGBEnabled(context, !mIsDefault);
1400 }
1401 }
1402}
1403
1404bool FramebufferGL::modifyInvalidateAttachmentsForEmulatedDefaultFBO(
1405 size_t count,
1406 const GLenum *attachments,
1407 std::vector<GLenum> *modifiedAttachments) const
1408{
1409 bool needsModification = mIsDefault && mFramebufferID != 0;
1410 if (!needsModification)
1411 {
1412 return false;
1413 }
1414
1415 modifiedAttachments->resize(count);
1416 for (size_t i = 0; i < count; i++)
1417 {
1418 switch (attachments[i])
1419 {
1420 case GL_COLOR:
1421 (*modifiedAttachments)[i] = GL_COLOR_ATTACHMENT0;
1422 break;
1423
1424 case GL_DEPTH:
1425 (*modifiedAttachments)[i] = GL_DEPTH_ATTACHMENT;
1426 break;
1427
1428 case GL_STENCIL:
1429 (*modifiedAttachments)[i] = GL_STENCIL_ATTACHMENT;
1430 break;
1431
1432 default:
1433 UNREACHABLE();
1434 break;
1435 }
1436 }
1437
1438 return true;
1439}
1440
1441angle::Result FramebufferGL::readPixelsRowByRow(const gl::Context *context,
1442 const gl::Rectangle &area,
1443 GLenum originalReadFormat,
1444 GLenum format,
1445 GLenum type,
1446 const gl::PixelPackState &pack,
1447 GLubyte *pixels) const
1448{
1449 ContextGL *contextGL = GetImplAs<ContextGL>(context);
1450 const FunctionsGL *functions = GetFunctionsGL(context);
1451 StateManagerGL *stateManager = GetStateManagerGL(context);
1452 GLubyte *originalReadFormatPixels = pixels;
1453
1454 const gl::InternalFormat &glFormat = gl::GetInternalFormatInfo(format, type);
1455
1456 GLuint rowBytes = 0;
1457 ANGLE_CHECK_GL_MATH(contextGL, glFormat.computeRowPitch(type, area.width, pack.alignment,
1458 pack.rowLength, &rowBytes));
1459 GLuint skipBytes = 0;
1460 ANGLE_CHECK_GL_MATH(contextGL,
1461 glFormat.computeSkipBytes(type, rowBytes, 0, pack, false, &skipBytes));
1462
1463 ScopedEXTTextureNorm16ReadbackWorkaround workaround;
1464 angle::Result result =
1465 workaround.Initialize(context, area, originalReadFormat, format, type, skipBytes, rowBytes,
1466 glFormat.computePixelBytes(type), pixels);
1467 if (result != angle::Result::Continue)
1468 {
1469 return result;
1470 }
1471
1472 gl::PixelPackState directPack;
1473 directPack.alignment = 1;
1474 ANGLE_TRY(stateManager->setPixelPackState(context, directPack));
1475
1476 GLubyte *readbackPixels = workaround.Pixels();
1477 readbackPixels += skipBytes;
1478 for (GLint y = area.y; y < area.y + area.height; ++y)
1479 {
1480 ANGLE_GL_TRY(context,
1481 functions->readPixels(area.x, y, area.width, 1, format, type, readbackPixels));
1482 readbackPixels += rowBytes;
1483 }
1484
1485 if (workaround.IsEnabled())
1486 {
1487 return RearrangeEXTTextureNorm16Pixels(
1488 context, area, originalReadFormat, format, type, skipBytes, rowBytes,
1489 glFormat.computePixelBytes(type), pack, originalReadFormatPixels, workaround.Pixels());
1490 }
1491
1492 return angle::Result::Continue;
1493}
1494
1495angle::Result FramebufferGL::readPixelsAllAtOnce(const gl::Context *context,
1496 const gl::Rectangle &area,
1497 GLenum originalReadFormat,
1498 GLenum format,
1499 GLenum type,
1500 const gl::PixelPackState &pack,
1501 GLubyte *pixels,
1502 bool readLastRowSeparately) const
1503{
1504 ContextGL *contextGL = GetImplAs<ContextGL>(context);
1505 const FunctionsGL *functions = GetFunctionsGL(context);
1506 StateManagerGL *stateManager = GetStateManagerGL(context);
1507 GLubyte *originalReadFormatPixels = pixels;
1508
1509 const gl::InternalFormat &glFormat = gl::GetInternalFormatInfo(format, type);
1510
1511 GLuint rowBytes = 0;
1512 ANGLE_CHECK_GL_MATH(contextGL, glFormat.computeRowPitch(type, area.width, pack.alignment,
1513 pack.rowLength, &rowBytes));
1514 GLuint skipBytes = 0;
1515 ANGLE_CHECK_GL_MATH(contextGL,
1516 glFormat.computeSkipBytes(type, rowBytes, 0, pack, false, &skipBytes));
1517
1518 ScopedEXTTextureNorm16ReadbackWorkaround workaround;
1519 angle::Result result =
1520 workaround.Initialize(context, area, originalReadFormat, format, type, skipBytes, rowBytes,
1521 glFormat.computePixelBytes(type), pixels);
1522 if (result != angle::Result::Continue)
1523 {
1524 return result;
1525 }
1526
1527 GLint height = area.height - readLastRowSeparately;
1528 if (height > 0)
1529 {
1530 ANGLE_TRY(stateManager->setPixelPackState(context, pack));
1531 ANGLE_GL_TRY(context, functions->readPixels(area.x, area.y, area.width, height, format,
1532 type, workaround.Pixels()));
1533 }
1534
1535 if (readLastRowSeparately)
1536 {
1537 gl::PixelPackState directPack;
1538 directPack.alignment = 1;
1539 ANGLE_TRY(stateManager->setPixelPackState(context, directPack));
1540
1541 GLubyte *readbackPixels = workaround.Pixels();
1542 readbackPixels += skipBytes + (area.height - 1) * rowBytes;
1543 ANGLE_GL_TRY(context, functions->readPixels(area.x, area.y + area.height - 1, area.width, 1,
1544 format, type, readbackPixels));
1545 }
1546
1547 if (workaround.IsEnabled())
1548 {
1549 return RearrangeEXTTextureNorm16Pixels(
1550 context, area, originalReadFormat, format, type, skipBytes, rowBytes,
1551 glFormat.computePixelBytes(type), pack, originalReadFormatPixels, workaround.Pixels());
1552 }
1553
1554 return angle::Result::Continue;
1555}
1556} // namespace rx
